result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon Scott Belott

records.addlTxt:
9:31 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Huber in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Brandon Scott Belott in court.  Attorney Gloria V Rodriguez in court for Brandon Scott Belott pro hac vice, under the supervision of Attorney Mark Shaw, who appears by zoom. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 22CF591/22CF619/22TR3828-3830. Victim rights compliance. Attorney Rodriguez advises the Court that they still have not received the discovery from the State. ADA Huber requests the defense file a discovery demand and will need an email address for Attorney Rodriguez as most of the discovery is sent via email. Court will adjourn to allow the defense time to request and review the discovery. Attorney Rodriguez requests that Attorney Shaw be excused at the next pretrial hearing; Court grants request for reasons set forth on the record. TR cases continue to trail.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Brandon Scott Belott
Current: 30357 Durand Ave, Burlington, WI 53105 United States  (Effective: 08-08-2022)
Prior: 270 Lakewood Drive, Antioch, IL 60002 United States

State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Rodriguez.  Clerk. M.Burke. Motion for Pro Hac Vice. Court approves the motion for pro hac vice and allows Attorney Gloria Rodriguez to represent the DE with the supervision of Attorney Mark Shaw. Bond motion. State advises they have received the safety plane and a letter from the victim that she wishes to have contact with the DE. Court amends bond to allow no violent contact with the victim Nikki M. and no discussion of the case. The DE may not reside with Nikki m.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  No violent contact or discussion of the case with Nikki M. The DE may not reside with Nikki M.  The DE may make arrangements with a party or law enforcement to retrieve personal property and/or medication from the victim, Nikki M's residence within 48 hours of signing the bond in this case.  The DE may not be the party retrieving any property and/or medication.
from the court re: Judicial Rotation 8/1/22

Defendant, Brandon Scott Belott, appeared with Attorney Gloria Rodriguez.  Attorney Zachary L Brost appeared for the Prosecution.    Clerk JT  Minutes:  Atty Rodriguez reports to the Court she has filed pro hac vice paperwork ; WI Bar has deposited check and opened a portal but not assigned a number yet this morning.  DE indicates to the Court he wants to proceed to prelim hearing today with Atty Rodriguez.   Court allows Atty Rodriguez to appear today.    ST called witness KSD Dep Keith Kirwan; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty . ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause found; bound over for trial. Information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 09:30 am.

At completion of hearing a bar number had been assigned to Atty Rodriguez.

for admission pro hac vice
Gloria R. Rodriguez
edoc to JA/JU

ADDRESS INFO for Brandon Scott Belott
Current: 270 Lakewood Drive, Antioch, IL 60002 United States  (Effective: 05-04-2022)
Prior: 7755 243rd Avenue, Salem, WI 53168 
Finance notified

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Nikki M or any pets belonging to victim.  The DE may make arrangements with a party or law enforcement to retrieve personal property and/or medication from the victim, Nikki M's residence within 48 hours of signing the bond in this case.  The DE may not be the party retrieving any property and/or medication.

02:22 PM   Deputy District Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Seth Johnson.  Clerk: P. Trossen.  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on May 19, 2022 at 09:45 am. $200  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).  sg
